Berani Nunggak Iuran? Siap-siap Terima Ini dari BPJS Kesehatan
01 Nov 2019, 08:10 by Trio Hamdani


Foto: Pradita Utama

Jakarta - Jumlah penunggak berpotensi meningkat imbas kenaikan iuran BPJS Kesehatan tahun depan sebesar 100%. Itu berlaku untuk Peserta Bukan Penerima Upah (PBPU) dan bukan pekerja alias peserta mandiri.Lantas apakah pihak BPJS Kesehatan sudah mengantisipasi hal tersebut?Direktur Utama BPJS Kesehatan Fachmi ldris mengatakan, isu tersebut memang cukup menjadi perhatian belakangan ini pasca keputusan resmi kenaikan iuran BPJS Kesehatan."Bisa jadi di antara ini kemudian teman-teman akan menjadi peserta non aktif (tidak bayar iuran)," kata dia di Kantor Pusat BPJS Kesehatan, Jakarta, Jumat (1/11/2019).Pihaknya lanjut dia, sudah memiliki prosedur dalam menghadapi peserta non aktif alias nunggak iuran dengan cara persuasif."Nanti peserta yang terdaftar kemudian menunggak itu kami harus lakukan penagihan. Bagaimana cara menagihnya, tentu kami menggunakan cara-cara yang paling lembut, paling persuasif," jelasnya.Jadi BPJS Kesehatan memiliki semacam alat monitor. Di situ akan kelihatan mana peserta yang nunggak iuran. Nantinya mereka akan diingatkan untuk segera melunasi tagihannya, mulanya melalui telepon."Telepon diingatkan, telepon diingatkan, itu sampai tiga bulan," sebutnya.Jika dalam tiga bulan itu tidak juga ada itikad baik dari penunggak iuran BPJS Kesehatan, maka pihaknya akan melakukan penagihan secara langsung sampai akhirnya mereka membayar tagihannya."Artinya penagihan langsung, diingatkan lagi diingatkan lagi. Nah itu tahapan pendekatan non regulatif," tambahnya.Simak Video "Keanggotaan BPJS Kesehatan 200 Lebih Ribu Warga Dinonaktifkan!"[Gambas:Video 20detik](toy/eds)

Dare to Delinquent Contributions? Get ready to receive this from BPJS Health
Nov 01 2019, 08:10 by Trio Hamdani


Photo: Pradita Utama

Jakarta - The number of arrears has the potential to increase the impact of next year's BPJS Health contribution increase of 100%. That applies to Non-Wage Recipient Participants (PBPU) and not employees alias independent participants. Then is the Health BPJS already anticipating this? Director of BPJS Health Fachmi Idris said, the issue was indeed quite a concern lately after the official decision on the increase in BPJS Health contributions "It could be that among these then friends will become non-active participants (not paying dues)," he said at the BPJS Health Office, Jakarta, Friday (11/01/2019). His side continued, he already has procedures in to deal with non-active participants, in a persuasive way. "Later, participants who are registered and then in arrears, we have to do billing. How to collect them, of course we use the softest, most persuasive ways," he explained. So BPJS Health has a kind of tool the monitor. There will be seen which participants are in arrears. Later they will be reminded to immediately pay their bills, initially by telephone. "The telephone is reminded, the telephone is reminded, it will take up to three months," he said. If within three months there is also no good faith from the arrears BPJS Health contributions, then his party will do the billing in a manner immediately until they finally paid the bill. "It means direct billing, reminded again to be reminded again. Now that's the stage of a non-regulative approach," he added.
